description.value: Whenever the dragon ends its turn, any dazing, stunning, dominating effect on it ends.

On an initiative of 10 + the dragon's initiative check, the dragon can move up to its speed as a free action. The dragon can move through enemies' spaces and gains resist 5 to all damage during the move. Each time the dragon enters an enemy's space for the first time during the move, it can use claw against that enemy. If the attack hits, the target also falls prone. If the dragon cannot use a free action to take this move due to a dominating or stunning effect, then that effect ends instead of the dragon making this move.
While the dragon is bloodied, it can score a critical hit on a roll of 17-20.

Basic Attack

At-Will âœ¦ cold

Standard

Attack: Melee 3 (one creature)

+22 vs. AC

Hit: 5d12 + 14 cold damage.

Miss: 1d12 cold damage.

At-Will

Standard

Attack: Melee 3 (one creature)

+22 vs. AC

Hit: 3d10 + 10 damage.

At-Will

Standard

Effect: The dragon uses claw twice.

Recharge 5-6 âœ¦ cold

Standard

Attack: Ranged 10 (one creature)

+20 vs. Reflex

Hit: The target is stunned, cannot be pulled, pushed, or slid, and takes ongoing 45 cold damage (save ends all).

Aftereffect: The target is slowed and takes ongoing 20 cold damage (save ends both).

Recharge 5-6 âœ¦ cold

Standard

Attack: Close blast 5 (creatures in the blast)

+20 vs. Reflex

Hit: 6d10 + 13 cold damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).

Miss: Half damage.

At-Will

Triggered

Trigger: An enemy hits the dragon while flanking it.

Attack (Free Action): Melee 3 (the triggering enemy)

+20 vs. Fortitude

Hit: 2d8 + 6 damage, and the dragon pushes the target up to 5 squares.

Encounter

Triggered

Trigger: The dragon is first bloodied.

Effect (Free Action): Breath weapon recharges, and the dragon uses it.
